alert.note: Alert for Wallowa County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Freezing Fog Advisory issued January 26 at 7:48PM PST until January 27 at 5:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: Updated fog wording for the Bend area in Central Oregon ...FREEZING FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter of a mile to one half of a mile in freezing fog, and possibly less than one quarter mile at times. * WHERE...Wallowa County, especially the Wallowa Valley and other valleys. * WHEN...Until 5 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility and potential frost or ice on bridges. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There may also be localized areas of freezing drizzle or fine light snow at times with the fog or low stratus, which will create slick roadways, sidewalks and parking lots. However, any accumulations will be very light and less than a tenth of an inch.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you. Also, be alert for frost on bridge decks causing slippery roads.
